About.name: Guilherme Pinheiro Ferreira
About.bio: Married to Vanessa and father of Liz, born in Campinas and living in São Paulo since childhood. Studying design and animation in Vancouver broadened my creative perspective. As a UI/UX Designer, I focus on solving visual problems simply and functionally to enrich the user experience. I value research and work with hypotheses and data to optimize processes and automate workflows, seeking continuous improvement. In my free time, I enjoy video games, board games, series, movies, anime, and reading — from fiction to Bible studies. I also love learning about subjects that spark my curiosity.

challenge.title: The challenge
challenge.description: The SME Digital: Livro project aimed to export static print textbooks files made for print into a dynamic digital experience.

techbarr.title: Technical barriers
content: Pages did not match the original design, with lots of visual inconsistencies.
Lack of text-to-speech support and proper labeling.
Exports often exceeded 300 MB, creating storage issues.
High SVG counts slowed loading and caused crashes.

objective.title: Objective
objective.description: To transform traditional high school textbooks into an interactive, accessible digital format.

research.title: Research and insights
research.content: We redesigned the app to be user-centric while meeting board requirements for an interactive book app, guided by insights from users, educators, and research.

insights.title: Digital-print sync
insights.content: We saw the need to sync digital and print pages, putting students usign both formats on the same page.

insights.title: Accessibility features
insights.content: Text-to-speech, font customization, and colorblind-friendly highlights.

insights.title: Scalable production
insights.content: Automation was key to faster production and consistent updates.

solutions.title: Solutions implemented
solutions.content: Implemented features guided by userflows, feature maps, wireframes and prototypes to enhance accessibility, navigation and performance.

content.title: User experience
content.content: Redesigned interface simplified navigation, providing a seamless and user-friendly experience across devices.

content.title: Educator support
content.content: Introduced tools like a teacher's book setting to display exercise answers and the ability to export notes to PDF, enhancing instructional effectiveness.

content.title: Accessibility gains
content.content: Enhanced usability for students with special needs.

content.title: Interactive features
content.content: Cloud-synced notes and highlights, and audio players to enhance the learning experience.

content.title: Increased engagement
content.content: Boosted app usage on both web and mobile platforms, reflecting improved user satisfaction and adoption.

content.title: Scalability
content.content: Enhanced usability for students with special needs.

content.title: User-Centric Design
content.content: Understanding user needs drove impactful design solutions.

content.title: Persistence and innovation
content.content: Resilience in overcoming resistance led to a transformative solution.

content.title: Collaboration
content.content: Working with educators, developers, and accessibility experts enhanced the product's quality.

content.title: Stakeholder alignment
content.content: Balanced user experience with stakeholder expectations for a successful outcome.
